citations.narrative:
On or about March 7, 2025, at an exhibition at a school, a Coati Mundi named Rocket was being held and exhibited by an
employee. The Coati Mundi superficially bit a child on the forearm. The employee and licensee were unaware of the
incident until it was brought to their attention approximately 45 minutes after the event. The licensee stated that there was
a small pink area on the forearm and it did not break the skin.
Exhibitions that do not allow sufficient distances or have barriers between the animals and the public can lead to injury for
the animals or the public.
The licensee must ensure that during public exhibition, any animal is handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the
animal and to the public, with sufficient distance and/or barriers between the animal and the general viewing public so as
to assure the safety of animals and the public.
To be corrected from March 19, 2025 forward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.131(c)(1) 
   
Handling of animals. 
On or about March 7, 2025, at an exhibition at a school, a Coati Mundi named Rocket was being held and exhibited by an 
employee. The Coati Mundi superficially bit a child on the forearm. The employee and licensee were unaware of the 
incident until it was brought to their attention approximately 45 minutes after the event. The licensee stated that there was 
a small pink area on the forearm and it did not break the skin. 
Exhibitions that do not allow sufficient distances or have barriers between the animals and the public can lead to injury for 
the animals or the public. 
The licensee must ensure that during public exhibition, any animal is handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the 
animal and to the public, with sufficient distance and/or barriers between the animal and the general viewing public so as 
to assure the safety of animals and the public. 
To be corrected from March 19, 2025 forward. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
